Penny was scared at first, but soon it felt better. It chirped and ate and drank. Jill watched it and smiled. She was glad she could care for Penny. She hoped Penny would get well soon and fly again. She was a good friend to Penny.

large predator was prowling around, looking for something to eat. The little girl was scared, so she ran towards her house, screaming for help.
The child's father heard her cries and came to her aid. He quickly grabbed a brick from the pile and threw it at the predator. The predator ran away. The child was very scared, but her father had protected her from danger. He hugged her tight and told her how brave she was.
The child was relieved to be safely at home again. From that day onwards, she was always reminded of the importance of being protected by her family.

After a while, Tim's mom came in and saw the fun he was having. She smiled and said, "Tim, you found the perfect place to play with your toy!" Tim smiled back and continued to shoot water at his duck, having lots of fun in his bathtub.
